Latitude of the location where the sample was collected in WGS 84 coordinate system. (‘Start latitude’ for linear sampling features such as dredges.) Needs to be entered in decimal degrees. Negative values for South latitudes.

End latitude of the location where the sample was collected in WGS 84 coordinate system. ('End latitude’ for linear sampling features such as dredges.) Needs to be entered in decimal degrees. Negative values for South latitudes.

Longitude of the location where the sample was collected in WGS 84 cooridinate system. (‘Start longitude’ for linear sampling features such as dredges.) Needs to be entered in decimal degrees. Negative values for ‘West’ longitudes.
End longitude of the location where the sample was collected in WGS 84 cooridinate system. Needs to be entered in decimal degrees. Negative values for ‘West’ longitudes.
Other name(s) used for the sample.
Taxonomy (formal classification) Formal categorization of sample.
Date when the sample was collected.
Date when the sample collection was finished (if a date range is provided).
Precision to display the collection date and time.
Method by which a sample was collected
Additional information about the collection method
End time when the sample was collected.
Name of the person who collected the sample. In case of larger field programs, name of chief scientist responsible for sample collection.
Institution, address, & email of the collector or chief scientist.
Name of institution, museum, or repository where the sample is currently stored.
Address and/or email of the person who should be contacted for information about or access to the sample.
maximum depth in core in meters
Minimum depth in core in meters
Unit in which the depth is provided
Taxonomy (field name) Informal classification of sample.
Name or identifier of the field program (cruise or expedition), during which the sample was collected.
Age of a sample as described by the stratigraphic era, period, state, etc.
A body of rock established as a distinct entity in the classification of the Earth’s rocks, e.g. Supergroup, Group, Formation, or Flow
Additional information about the specific place where your sample was collected
Free text description of the location
Material that the sample consists of using SESAR vocabulary.
Name of the physiographic feature that you entered
Type of physical feature that your sample was collected from (see suggested list)
Date when sample metadata is publicly accessible and searchable. If null, defaults to date of registration (recommended).
Size of the registered object, such as the dimension of a specimen, the length of a core, or the weight of a dredge
Unit for the numerical value provided for ‘size’.
State or Province where the sample was collected
More descriptive Object Type. This applies only to samples with Object Type set to Individual Sample.
Vertical datum used to calculate the elevation
Zone for the geographic Cartesian coordinate "11R"
